turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Checkmate.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: What are you waiting? My social security will expire, you'll still be sitting there.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm thinking.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: So think already.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You have any idea how long it takes for those things to decompose?

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: You don't move soon. I'll begin to decompose.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: David, I've been meaning to talk with you. It's nice you've been spending so much time with me, but...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Dad, don't start.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: I'm only saying, it's been what? Four years, you still haven't signed your divorce papers.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Three years.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: Three, four. Move on. It's not healthy.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Pops!

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: The television said they've started with the looting already. Vultures.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You still got the Olds?

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: You want to borrow the car? You don't have a license.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That's okay. You're driving.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: It's the White House, for crying out loud. You can't just drive up and ring the bell.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Can't this thing go any faster?

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: You think they don't know what you know? Believe me, they know. She works for the President. They know everything.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: They don't know this.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: And you're going to educate them? Tell me something, you're so smart how come you spent eight years at M.I.T. to become a cable repairman?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Dad...

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: All I'm saying is they've got people who handle these things, David. They want HBO, they'll call you.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: This, pops, is every phone book in America.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: You think an important person like Constance is going to be listed?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: She always keeps her portable phone listed, for emergencies. Sometimes it's just her first initial, sometime her nickname...

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: Not listed, huh?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I just haven't found it yet. I tried C. Halbrook, Connie Halbrook, Spunky Halbrook...

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: Spunky?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: College nickname.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: You try Martin?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: She didn't take my name when we were married.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Perfect, she's using it.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: It's perfect the line is busy?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes. I can use he signal to triangulate her exact position in the White House.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: You can do that?

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: Sure he'll listen. Why wouldn't he?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Because last time I saw him I punched him in the face.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: You punched the President in the face?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: He wasn't the President then.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: It's Air Force One for crying out loud. Still he gets sick?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Moishe, please, don't talk.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Dad, please...

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: What was it, Roswell? You had the space ship, the bodies, everything locked up in a bunker, the what is it, Area fifty one. That's it! Area fifty one. You knew and you didn't do nothing!

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: David, David! What the hell are you doing!?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm making a mess.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: This I can see.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We've gotta burn the rain forest, Pops. Dump toxic waste, pollute the air, rip up the ozone. Maybe if we screw this planet up enough they won't want it anymore.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: David, you're drunk.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Pops, you're a genius!

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: What'd I say?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A cold? Of course.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Thanks, Pops.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: I want you should know, I'm very proud of you, son.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'll see how they're doing with the radio transmitter.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Oh shit, we're late.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We'll meet you there.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I have a confession to make. I'm not real big on flying.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Just getting a feel for her.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Must be thousands of them. What are they doing?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Looks like they're preparing the invasion.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Get us out of here!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I can't shake her free.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: What're you doing?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's not me. They're overriding the system.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Nice meeting you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You as well.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: We're loose!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Doesn't matter. Game's over.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I don't hear no fat lady.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: With your permission, Mr. President, I'd like to remain my your side.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I had a feeling you would.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Sir, what happens if they do become hostile?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Then God help us.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: General Grey, co-ordinate with Atlantic Command. Tell them they have twenty five minutes to get as many people out of the cities as they can.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: But Mr. President...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: And get those helicopters away from the ship. Call them back immediately.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Is my wife in the air?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: She should be shortly.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Any news on my wife?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: The helicopter never arrived at Nellis and there's been no radio contact.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: ETA with target; four minutes.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Atlanta, Chicago and Philadelphia, destroyed?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: And there are scattered reports of sightings over Miami, Ft. Worth, And Memphis.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: And our forces?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: We're down to approximately fifteen percent, Sir.  If you calculate the time it takes them to destroy a city and move on, we're looking at world wide destruction of every major city within the next thirty six hours.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: We're being exterminated.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Organize every plane you can find and get some Goddamned pilots to fly them.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Yes, Sir.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: How're we doing?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Better than we thought.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: We have confirmed divisions of troops from different armies all around the world. Most of Europe, the Middle East and Asia are battle ready.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: And our troops here?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: We've been collecting planes from all over but...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: But what, General?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Pilots, sir. We don't have enough people to get them in the air.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Then find them.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Mr. President, just what do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'm a pilot, Will. This is where I belong.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Grey, you read me?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Roger, Eagle One, our primary target has shifted course.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Where's it headed?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: I think our secret is out. They're headed right for us.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Do not engage until we've confirmed the package has been delivered.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: Get on the horn with Atlantic Command. Let's upgrade the situation to DEFCON 3.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: That's not your call to make, Mr. Nimziki.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: Organize a military escort to Crystal Mountain.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Sir, I strongly recommend we move you to a secured location immediately.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: More ships keep arriving, fifteen in total so far.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: This is crazy. We're loosing our first strike capabilities!

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: We're trying to communicate with them on all frequencies but we're getting nowhere. Atlantic Command is working on a type of visual communication.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: That's impossible...

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: My God, the Vice President and the Joint Chiefs...

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: Mr. President, we must launch. A delay now would be more costly than when you waited to evacuate the cities!

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: You were the head of the National Intelligence Agency! You knew all about this. When were you planning on informing the rest of us!?

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: It had been deemed classified.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: Christ, why didn't you say anything about this when they first arrived? You could have warned us before we launched a counter attack that cost us hundreds of American pilots!

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: This is ridiculous.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: How long would their shields be down?

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: With their shields down it might be possible.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: Please, you're not buying into any of this nonsense, are you? We don't have the manpower or the resources to launch that kind of a campaign.  Not to mention that this whole cockamamie plan is dependent on a machine that no one in the world is qualified to operate.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: A meteor?

turns.speaker: SECOND OFFICER
turns.text: No Sir. Definitely not.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: SECOND OFFICER
turns.text: Well, er... it's slowing down.

turns.speaker: GENERAL GREY
turns.text: It's doing what?

turns.speaker: SECOND OFFICER
turns.text: It's... slowing down, Sir.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: He's trying to impress you.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: He's doing a good job.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: You can't go. Call them back.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Baby, you know how it is. I have to report to El Toro right away.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: You said you were on leave for the Fourth.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: They cancelled it. Why are you acting like this?

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Wait. I have to tell you something.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Be careful.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Look, after your shift tonight, why don't you grab Dylan and come stay with me on base.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Really? You don't mind?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Naw. I'll just tell my other girlfriends they can't come over tonight.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: You know, you're not as charming as you think you are.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Yes, I am.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Dick-weed!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Butt-munch.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You know how I like to make a big entrance.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You know me...

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: I know, you like to make a big entrance.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Before we do this, I want you to know I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Sorry for what?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I should have done this a long long time ago.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: You scared the hell out of me.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Yeah, but what an entrance!

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Dick-weed.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Butt-munch.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Your son.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: He's my angel.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Was his father stationed here?

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: He wasn't his father. I was kinda hoping he'd want the job, though.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: So, what do you do for a living?

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: I'm a dancer.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Really? Ballet?

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: No. Exotic.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Oh. Sorry.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Don't be. I'm not. It's good money.  'Side, he's worth it.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: And when the dancing's over? What about your future?

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Funny, it used to scare me when I thought about the future.  Guess it doesn't really matter anymore.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Dylan, come here. I want you to meet the First Lady.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: I thought you didn't recognize me.

turns.speaker: JASMINE
turns.text: Didn't want to say anything. I voted for the other guy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I don't believe it. They make you learn how to fly everything from an Apache to a Harrier and still they turn you down? What else do they want you to learn?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: How to kiss ass.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Jasmine has this thing for dolphins. I had them make it...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I thought you said you were doing to break it off.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: That is an affirmative. I have victory dance. Mmmmmmm.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Don't get premature on me, Jimmy. We don't light up 'til the Fat Lady sings.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I hear you.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I shouldn't have left her.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Don't worry, big guy. I'm sure she got out of here before it happened.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Damn it!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I didn't even see them fire!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Command, Eagle One. Switching to "sidewinders." We're moving in.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Jimmy, kick it! They're gaining.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: We're already over Mach 2!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: So push it!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Stevie... I can't...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Jimmy, stay with me.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: It's all fuzzy.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: You're gonna break it. Just leave it alone. Here, take your medicine.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I don't need it.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Just take it, dick head.  Alicia! Make sure he takes his medicine.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: He's got that SEGA Saturn CD, 64 bit, right?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Yeah. What would you think if we went there to live for a while?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: That'd be cool!

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: But I gave you some this morning.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I didn't take it. I thought I didn't need it anymore.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: RUSSELL
turns.text: I'm bringing home the bacon. Earning my keep. And doing a fine job if I do say so myself.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: It's the wrong field, you idiot! Lucas' farm is on the other side of town.

turns.speaker: RUSSELL
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: Damn it, he was doing you a favor. You know how hard it is to find someone who doesn't think you're completely crazy? What are we supposed to do now? Huh? Where are we supposed to go now?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: They let you out?

turns.speaker: RUSSELL
turns.text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: We're leaving, don't try and stop us.

turns.speaker: RUSSELL
turns.text: You're not going anywhere. You hear me? I'm still your father.

turns.speaker: RUSSELL
turns.text: Troy's still my son no matter how you feel about me.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: For once in your life think about what's best for Troy. Who has to beg for money to buy him medicine when you screw up? Who?

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: I couldn't find anything. Everyone is packing up, they're leaving. Word is a space ship is heading this way.

turns.speaker: RUSSELL
turns.text: We should leave too.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: There's a group heading south, they said there's a hospital just a couple hours away. I think we should follow them.

turns.speaker: MIGUEL
turns.text: How' he doing?

turns.speaker: RUSSELL
turns.text: Just fell asleep. He's gonna be just fine. Join me in a little celebration?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'm not leaving.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: We must maintain a working government in a time of crisis...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I want the Vice President, Secretary of Defense, the whole Cabinet and the Joint Chiefs taken to a secured location. I'm staying here. I am not going to add to a public hysteria that could cost lives.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: But, Mr. President...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: So far these things have not become hostile. For the moment let's assume they won't.  Connie, let's issue statements advising people not to panic, to stay home and take cover.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: What the hell's going on?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: We're leaving.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: I spoke with the Joint Chief when they arrived at NORAD. They agree, we must launch a counter offensive with a full nuclear strike. Hit 'em with everything we've got.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Above American soil?

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: If we don't strike soon, there may not be much of an America left to defend.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Why the hell wasn't I told about this place?

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: Two words, Mr. President. Plausible deniability.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: Mr. President?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Deploy.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Call them back.

turns.speaker: NIMZIKI
turns.text: The other bombers might have more luck. We shouldn't just give up...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I said call them back.

turns.speaker: OKUN
turns.text: Mr. President, a real pleasure. They don't let us out much, you know.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: OKUN
turns.text: Well, I guess you'd like to see the big tamale? Follow me.

turns.speaker: OKUN
turns.text: See, we can't duplicate their type of power so we've never been able to experiment. But since these guys started showing up, all the gizmos inside turned on. The last twenty four hours have been really exciting!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: People are dying out there. I don't think "exciting" is the word I'd choose to describe it!

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: What can you tell us about the enemy we're facing?

turns.speaker: OKUN
turns.text: Not all too dissimilar to us. Breathes oxygen, comparable tolerances to heat, cold... probably why they're interested in our planet.  Hey, you wanna see them?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Can they be killed?

turns.speaker: OKUN
turns.text: These three died in the crash. Their bodies are as frail as our own. You just have to get past their technology, which is, I'm sorry to say, far more advanced.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Why did you people come here?

turns.speaker: OKUN/ALIEN
turns.text: Air... water... your "sun."

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Where do your people come from?  Where is your home?

turns.speaker: OKUN/ALIEN
turns.text: Here... now.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: And before here?

turns.speaker: OKUN/ALIEN
turns.text: Many worlds...

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Can we negotiate a truce? Is there room for co-existance?  Can there be peace between us?

turns.speaker: OKUN/ALIEN
turns.text: Peace? No peace.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: What do you want us to do?

turns.speaker: OKUN/ALIEN
turns.text: Die.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Oh, Sallah! What a relief!

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: Marcus Brody, sir. And where is Indy?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Oh, he's in Austria. A slight detour.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: You are on your own?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yes, but don't panic. Everything's under control. Have you... have you arranged our supplies?

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: Oh, yes, of course. But where are we going?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Oh, this map will show you. It was drawn by, uh...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Oh, what?... your servant, sir.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: And I am his.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: My reputation precedes me.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: There is no museum in Iskenderun.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: Papers, sir. Got it here.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: Egyptian Mail. Morning edition.  Run!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Did you say...? Uh, uh...

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: May we go home now, please?

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: The dog!?  You are named after the dog...

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Marcus!  I did it!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You've got it!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: You know how long I've been looking for that?!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: All your life.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: All my life!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Well done, Indy. Very well done, indeed. This will find a place of honor in our Spanish collection.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Your treat.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yes. My treat.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What has the old fool got himself into now?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I don't know. But whatever it is, he's in over his head!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Dad?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: It's today's mail. And it's been opened.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Venice, Italy!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: It's Dad's Grail Diary. Every clue he ever followed. Every discovery he made. A complete record of his search for the Holy Grail. This is his whole life. Why would he have sent this to me?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I don't know. But someone must want it pretty badly.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Do you believe, Marcus?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Do you believe the Grail actually exists?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: The search for the Cup of Christ is the search for the divine in all of us.
